Default introduction.Message 1: Sometimes we feel frustrated with our children because we expect them to behave in ways that they are not yet developmentally ready for.
Default introduction.Message 2: Learning about child development means we can have realistic expectations and also to spot any problems with their growth and development.
Default introduction.Interaction message: Would you like to learn more about this tip?
Default introduction.Message for negative answer 1: That's okay! You can always type "Help" if you want to learn more about child development.
Default introduction.Message for negative answer 2:
If you are concerned that your child might be delayed in their development, here is a link to services in your area that may also be helpful: [INSERT LOCAL LINK]

You can also visit UNICEF's website for more helpful information about child development [INSERT LOCAL UNICEF LINK]
Chat to you later!

Multiple choice.Message 1: All children develop at different rates. But there are some things that we expect children to be able to do at an age. These are called ‘development’ milestones.
Multiple choice.Message 2: Many things affect our children's development. For example, development is helped by eating healthy food, having immunisations, and parents or caregivers who talk to them a lot.
Multiple choice.Message 3: Which child development milestones do you want to learn about?

Set of messages 1.Message 1: Well done for adding another tool to your Parenting Toolkit! Knowing about child development can help you feel less frustrated by them.
Set of messages 1.Message 2:
If you are concerned that your child might be delayed in their development, here is a link to services in your area that may also be helpful: [INSERT LOCAL LINK]

You can also visit UNICEF's website for more helpful information about child development [INSERT LOCAL UNICEF LINK]
